website_summaries.verdict: An advanced charger, with an LCD screen and built-in alternator check. Brings batteries back to life that other chargers couldn't.
pros: Works quickly, with nice cord storage
Known to charge older dead batteries that other chargers couldn't
15-amp charger features 40-amp patented engine start to jump start a vehicle in 90 seconds
Charger device also checks for alternator issues and battery reconditioning to improve charge carrying capability and extend battery life
Automatically selects charge rate and adjusts from rapid charge to trickle charge to maximize battery life
Digital LCD screen displays charging status and battery status
cons: Some units have died after their first few uses
Needs a separate battery charge cable — that's not included — to connect the ground cable at a point away from the battery post

website_summaries.verdict: The perfect solution for portable car battery charging and engine jump starting. A must-have for any emergency roadside kit.
pros: High-capacity charging capabilities for larger batteries or quicker recharge times
Includes a 40-amp engine start function to jump start the car when necessary
cons: Reverse polarity function isn't always reliable

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I've had two perfectly dead batteries. When I try to charge them, the unit sent me a message that the batteries were fully charged after initially hooking up the cables. One of the batteries I brought to my mechanic for him to put on a conventional battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. I bought 2 Sears battery chargers...and each gave me about 2 yrs of life. I bought a Black and Decker brand a few years ago...loved it. It was smaller than this one, but I gave it to my brother since he needed one. I just bought this 25 amp with reconditioner...and so far, I reconditioned and charged up both vehicles. The unit comes with an internal cooling fan which maybe a bit loud to some, but I didn't hear it since the house and garage are separated. I haven't had a chance to use it to jump my car yet, but it says it can do that in 90 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: P. L.

customer_reviews.title: would not jump start a car as indicated, and does not refresh batteries
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a couple of batteries that I have. it charged a good battery that is 6 moths old just fine, however older batteries that we have in the shop it did not refresh when we used that function. made one battery practically boil. Definitely did not jump start a car either. I think I received a faulty unit and will probably get rid of it, its useless in a shop
customer_reviews.author: BmwM6fan

customer_reviews.title: from dead to start in under ten minutes
customer_reviews.text: Battery was good, just sat too long in classic car. This charger brought it from dead to started in under ten minutes. After that the alternator tested good and the battery is getting a full charge. After full charge it drops to trickle maintenance. Very versatile and strong unit with clear display and instructions. Waiting to try the recondition mode.
customer_reviews.author: TXgardener

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the battery charger stopped working after only a couple of uses. I was really excited about he options to check alternator function, battery reconditioning, etc... However, it quit working just after the warranty ran out. I’m going to refresh my research and probably go with a tried and true simpler charger design without all of the features that this one advertises. This is a design/manufacturing issue.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Hoopingarner

customer_reviews.title: Disposable throw away after 3 uses. will not work on dead battery.
customer_reviews.text: Will not charge a battery that is drained due to interior light left on, Battery MUST have a charge for charger to work. So it is useless if you want to start your car or charge your battery, caused by polarity check function. Must jjump car with another vehicle to get a partial charge, then you can finish the charging. The after 3 uses in 13 monthes it no longer works. Apparently when warrenty ends so does the charger. Black and Decker DID have a good reputation, no logner.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen  Vear

customer_reviews.title: Some are good others bad
customer_reviews.text: I gave it one star for looks. My first one that arrived did not work on charge, the replacement unit failed to work on reconditioning. Stanley should be ashamed and Stanley customer service extremely poor!
customer_reviews.author: BDK

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a bad charger? And of course customer service for it ...
customer_reviews.text: The charger won't stay charging for more than a few minutes and then kicks off. I have to keep going over and press the battery charge button. What is up with that? Did I get a bad charger? And of course customer service for it is only open open M-F 9-5 eastern time.
customer_reviews.author: S. V. Sudderth Mandell

customer_reviews.title: good repalcement for old charger
customer_reviews.text: works great with plenty of features. needed to replace old charger and this seemed (so far) to be the best replacement for me to use. I like the battery recon. and the alternator check features. The only thing I don't like is that there is no on/off switch on the unit. Clear easy to understand manual, as this charger is a bit different to use than the old one
customer_reviews.author: old flyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for stored vehicles
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! I have three motorcycles and can't ride them all the time. So, the batteries die when they sit idle. I put this on a dead battery and did the recondition process and the battery came back like new. Saves me a fortune. It also has a quick start option so you can fire up your car or motorcycle and let the charging take place while you ride (if you have a long trip). If you have any craft that sits a lot and the battery dies, get this and save yourself money.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Elder

customer_reviews.title: Ugh!!  Wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Product failed 7 mos after purchase and only 3 uses. Heard a pop and smoke billowed from the fan. Company seems willing to repair or exchange but I have to pay for return shipping and that’ll be about 1/2 the purchase cost. I’m evaluating he value of that since I don’t have much faith that the repair/replacement will last any longer. Furthermore, it won’t start a vehicle if the batter is very dead. That’s awful since you can now buy portable starting batteries that double as usb chargers for $40-$60.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A nice step up from basic battery chargers.
customer_reviews.text: The 90 amp engine start is a useful feature, gets the battery energized in about half the time as my 55 amp engine start did. The 25 amp variable rate charging is a huge improvement over the standard 10amp models. I like the battery recondition as well, but you have to run it for a whole day before it there's a noticeable improvement. Overall it's a nice step up from basic battery chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Lidz

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few different times for myself. Jumped started the neighbors car, worked perfect! I charged my caregivers battery...worked perfect. I did a battery reconditioning cycle on my truck battery. Battery holds 13.4 volts now. I Love this thing, so happy with it. Hope this helps, this was the second, first one had an issue with the Battery Reconditioning feature. No issues with anything on this one as of now. I have had it for almost 3 months now. I would TOTALLY recommend this to anyone looking for a great automatic charger, nicely done Stanley!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Wynne II

customer_reviews.title: Stanley 15 Amp Automatic Battery charger with recovery feature
customer_reviews.text: The charger is a little lighter than he old style and has strong clips. I like the battery recovery feature but I haven't had a battery to try to recover yet. The recovery feature is supposed to dissolve the sulphur salts in the battery that are causing some of the battery cells to short out. I bought it for this feature and will definitely test it in the future. The one thing I noticed about it from my older charger is that it takes a little longer to charge the battery but then it will not over charge a battery because it automatically goes into a maintenance mode as the battery is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: rshirley10

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after 2 months. The "FLO" indicator is supposed to indicate a full charge being maintained, yet whatever the voltage of the connected battery it jumps straight to "FLO" and doesnt charge. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best charger I have owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best charger I've ever owned. If you have a totally dead all you need to do is hook up a good battery along with the dead battery and they will both charge. The engine starter works great.just wanna say I'm still using it. Almost every week no issues at all.even the engine start feature work I was shocked
customer_reviews.author: Helper

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: I must I am very disappointed with this item. It has only been used about 3-4 times since purchased and 4 months out of the warranty period it stopped working. When plugged in all it does is flash the clamp icons. It’s practically new still..hasn’t been abused or mishandled. Will not purchase another item made by Stanley
customer_reviews.author: M. Salone

customer_reviews.title: FLO is no fun
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this unit gets confused. I have a battery that I am attempting to recondition. It is currently at 11.2V. Two multimeters confirm that voltage. This Stanley charger has different thoughts on the matter. It thinks the battery is at 12.7V. The result? It switches to float mode immediately. I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: DVB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It does not deliver as promised. It worked great on my mower for a recharge. But after it said that my car battery was fully charged the car would not start, just the sluggish movement of the starter. Recharged the battery again and set to engine start. No difference. It is also useless on a double battery diesel. A big waste of money. It does look pretty however.
customer_reviews.author: Wulf

customer_reviews.title: Would not jump start my car!
customer_reviews.text: I used it once to charge a battery and that seemed to work okay. But, then I needed to start my son's car that had a dead battery. I followed the instructions, waited for the countdown to complete, and the 2.5L 6-cylinder engine didn't even try to turn over. Nothing. Instead, I put the unit in battery charger mode, let the battery charge overnight, and the car started up. But, this unit is supposed to be an engine starter! If it won't turn over a small 6-cylinder, I'm not impressed. Thankfully, this happened while I was still bale to return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after the second usage!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine twice. The 3rd time it turned on, then as I turned on battery charge it turned off and has not worked since!! I bought two of these. One for a friend. And after 3 rd attempt it broke. Not good. Stanley products used to mean something. Tried product support, the page locked my phone up! Couldnt get in. Tried calling and auto messeging was making me nutz! Terrible, terrible terrible!
customer_reviews.author: johnny1x

customer_reviews.title: Seems Rugged and It is Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Charges my batteries quickly and has an easy to read display. I have two cars that only get driven on occasion, sometimes not for a couple of months. This charger can get them going quickly if I forget. I have only had it for a few months, so I can't talk yet about its long term status. It is easy to carry, as the handles are comfortable. The cables wrap nicely around the enclosure, so it ends up as a neat package when stored. Solid battery clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Winsemius

customer_reviews.title: bought so would have when needed and when i needed it it doesnt work and got rid of old charger when this one came in
customer_reviews.text: went to use it for first time and does not work and as soon as i plug it in it trips a circuit breaker tried multiple locations same results STANLEY BC25BS 25 Amp Bench Battery Charger...
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Great charger; however, fan issues.
customer_reviews.text: Charger and conditioner worked great for a few months. Then the cooling fan started making noise and the charger started shutting off due to overheating. I wrote Stanley warranty service and it took about two weeks for them to get back with me. The good news is they are sending a replacement without me having to send the old unit in. Once received I’ll see if I can replace the fan on the old one and will update post.
customer_reviews.author: Roadhammer

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Charger
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Charger. Very simple to use, quiet operation and doesn't get hot while charging or emit funny smells. I've charged my trucks, tractors, cars, mowers...everything I own and it did it flawlessly. Checked spot on with my multimeter. Easy to read screen and backlight remains on constantly, buttons respond with a nice click and are not mushy. Very good build quality, this one is made in Vietnam. Takes the guesswork out of charging batteries. In 50 years I've owned several chargers...so far this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: CHARGES GREAT - charges level reader not to be trusted
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t take long for a battery to fully charge, however, it seems the reader is off, during the charging period it seems to go back-and-forth as the battery car is charging. However if you unplug it it’ll say 100% and then replug it it’ll say it’s only at 75% so the actual battery charge level is questionable . It also at times simply shuts down for no reason and asks me to reclamp when he weather is actually quite perfect at 70 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: natureboy9

customer_reviews.title: Only got to use twice
customer_reviews.text: First two times I used this charger it worked fine. Third time, connected, plugged power cord in to outlet - nothing. Checked power source and it was fine. Charger wouldn't show any indication that it had power, nothing, just dead. Looked in manual to see if there was a reset but no luck. Six months past warranty so the first two charges cost $30 each.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Won't Charge You Battery Below 12 Volts
customer_reviews.text: The charger cannot be activated unless the machine reads a battery voltage of at least 12 volts. My battery was at 11.6 volts and so the machine refused to charge the battery. I attempted to use the desulfator feature for days but it only managed to get the battery from 11.6 to 11.8 and then stopped working. I had to buy a different charger to get my battery working. It works fine now but this machine was a waste of money for me. It's fully automatic so by definition you cannot manually control it to get the charger to activate. Proved quite useless for my situation. I don't like to leave negative reviews but I feel compelled this time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Pellegrino

customer_reviews.title: great charger and maintainer.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to charge up 2 12V batteries i use on the gazebo. Out there i have an inverter that powers 2 LED bulbs and some outlets for phone charging and a echo. This charger really works well. The only thing that scares me is that while you have a battery hooked up, in the shop, you can hit that 75amp start button and I'm terrified it'll blow up the battery. (In my case, it was my 6yo son that hit the button checking it out). It works well and its fast..
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Rees

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to occasionally jump my mower or car. I also intended to use it to maintain my mower over the winter. The first couple of times that I used it, it worked fantastically. I couldn't have been more pleased. Then I put it up for a while. Laster I connected it to my mower to maintain it over the winter. In the Spring, the battery was completely dead. I tried to jump the mower. The charger did not work at all. No charge. No boost. No nothing. At this point, it was out of warranty. Nothing to do but throw it away. I have been using battery chargers/boosters for over 50 years. This was the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Blp

customer_reviews.title: Hard to reach support via phone, had to find email address to get service
customer_reviews.text: Unit just less than 1 year and then keeps reporting FLO on any battery. I hsvr for weeks tried to call their support line, only to be put indefinite hold. Finally found an email address for customer support at Baccus Global. The rep sent me an RMA to get the unit serviced. I raised my rating to 3 because once i found a wsy to contact them they did what was needed to rectify the issue, but lost 2 stars for the 6 weeks it took to get ahold of someone and not answering the phone.
customer_reviews.author: redflash

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge car batteries when below 2 volts
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in the online description does it tell you it will not charge batteries that are drained below 2 volts. Only at the end of the manual is there an innocuous single sentence that alerts owners it will not work when battery is below 2 volts. Had to borrow daughter's $10 battery charger to recharge my car battery.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless, horrible tool
customer_reviews.text: Will NOT charge any fully dead battery, per Customer Service and the manual. If you don't have 2+ amps, it won't see the battery, so no functions are available. Completely useless, horrible tool, one more piece of utter junk from Stanley/Amazon. STOP SELLING JUNK. YOU WASTE MY TIME.
customer_reviews.author: vll

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!! UTTER GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not bother with this garbage product. I ordered two. The first cane in dead. Plugged in, nothing. I called Amazon. They rushed me a second one as my car is dead after knee surgery. It too is dead. I neededa reliable product to get my car back up and running. I got garbage. F you Stanley. Oh, and if it won’t come on, their customer service will tell you the product is faulty. Just return it. I hate mosern USA companies that produce utter crap and do nothing when their garbage (soon to be in a landfill near you) doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: M. LaBonte

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully no more cooked batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an OLD charger that kept killing my batteries. Using standard motorcycle batteries for a toy ride-on quad. The old chargers kept overcharging the batteries. This one seems to really do the trick. Hopefully, no more dead batteries. Easy to use. Planning to just tag sale the old chargers and just use this one for all vehicles!!! Haven't had to use it yet, but love the idea of providing start functions for a dead battery!
customer_reviews.author: marcelmib

customer_reviews.title: The charger does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: The charger worked as stated in directions for several months. Then I was charging a low battery and the charge shut off before the battery was charged. The only thing that I can figure happened is this: When the charger started charging it showed on the display the amperage. It kept rising and when it reach 25 amps the charger shut off and the battery was not charged. It stated on the charger that the max output was 25 amps, but I did not think that the charger would shut down when 25 amps was reach. If anyone has any explanation please let me know. I would not purchase this charger until this problem has been explained.
customer_reviews.author: ginnerpig

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used it once. It worked as advertised. It is lightweight and easy to use. I did not test the engine start feature or the battery reconditioning feature; I merely charged a battery. I bought this because my previous charger mysteriously disappeared. The old charger was much heavier and worked well for years. I am usually suspicious of things that seem too light weight.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice battery charger
customer_reviews.text: Well built and has a lot of features. Haven't had a chance to use them all. It will check the state of your battery and it charges intelligently. I have used it the 75 Amp start engine mode and, with a weak battery, it works well to get the engine started. With a dead batter not quite enough juice. Probably depends on the starter it is trying to turn also. Overall I really like it. Now I just hope it will last.
customer_reviews.author: JOLLYMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Black and Decker BC25BD with this. Its almost identically the same but a little cheaper. The BD the internal fan went bad which I'll probably replace. it had a hard life and I suspect this will last at least as long. Good value. The only minus is it should have had a power button. As with most electronic chargers, if your battery is on the way out or bad this charger will not change them. If it can't change them, you need a new battery. As to the reviews that say this charger isn't good, maybe its your battery that's not good.
customer_reviews.author: R. Muller

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in Stanley
customer_reviews.text: After reading through the instructions several times, I was finally able to make it do what I needed. Reconditioning mode actually seemed to revive lawnmower battery (temporarily at least). Put it on the shelf till I needed it a year later. That's when I discovered it was a "boat anchor" (JUNK!). Of course it was too late to return so, guess I need to keep track of my equipment purchases and retailers.
customer_reviews.author: Gunru

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Charger
customer_reviews.text: I love this battery charger. I was looking for a new battery charger as my last one was probably 30 years old and was no longer reliable. I didn't realize how far technology has come. The new features on this charger are all put to good use in my DIY garage. It's quite simple to use and works great. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Hammer

customer_reviews.title: not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for the battery reconditioning feature and it's hard to judge for that. It doesn't work very well for my smaller 12 volt batteries like on my UTV. It'll say fully charged but when I check it against my other chargers it's only to 80%. The fan also rattles if not setting just right. I should have returned it and I really wanted it to work well but it doesn't. It doesn't fully charge my larger batteries either. I just cant recomend it for any application. Maybe I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: toby

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: there is a fault with this charger. i have owned it for 3 months and used it 4-5 times. it is now broken and does the same thing a few other reviews have mentioned. when i hook the battery up it goes to float mode after 3-4 seconds. this charger is defective and amazon is continuing to allow sales. i am going to try to contact the manufacturer as the "return window" is closed. i am very unsatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Didn't charge a battery at 2.3v Didn't jump start my vehicle Maybe (???) the battery reconditioning worked, not sure. After 2/3 of this product's features failed, I tried another method: To solve my dead battery, I added distilled water to my battery then jump-started with another product (emergency lithium battery), and now I'm up and running fine.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge a completely dead battery
customer_reviews.text: This charger is worthless if the battery is totally discharged! It will not charge it! Amazing that it is designed in such a fashion. When I had a completely dead battery it would not charge it so I called the manufacturer thinking it was defective. But no, the representative said that is the way it is designed!? She said the battery had to have some residual charge for it to work. Why would anyone design a battery charger like this???
customer_reviews.author: Ed H.

customer_reviews.title: 2nd unit to arrive DOA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these from Amazon Warehouse. It arrived DOA. I ordered a replacement, which also arrived DOA. By DOA, I mean the unit will not even power on. I've tried multiple outlets in the house, rated from 10A to 20A. The 20A outlet works fine for my electric clothes dryer, but neither of these Stanley battery chargers will even power up. What good is a battery charger with no juice?
customer_reviews.author: GSVanWinkle

customer_reviews.title: "Worked once" then Failed.
customer_reviews.text: So after charging the batter for 1 hour, I attempted to use the "start" feature - No only did it trip a 30 amp breaker (also didnt trip the GFI it was on) - it but it didnt even start the car. From there on the device never worked again. I suspect its dead after letting it cool for almost 8 hours now. The support line is ONLY open M-F, I expected MUCH better quality from Stanley, but I guess names brands are for sale now and this device happens to be trash.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Useful smart car battery charger
customer_reviews.text: Well-behaved smart charger. Power and battery cable management is clumsy, but that's true of most chargers. The "percent charged" indicator is a digitally implemented analog display. A numerical display would be much easier to read. If I could add one feature it would be to charge 6 V batteries as well as 12 V.
customer_reviews.author: OldChemE

customer_reviews.title: Charges well, but overpriced for the features that do not seem to work
customer_reviews.text: It works well for topping up and float charging. The vehicle start function is not strong enough to "jump" any of my vehicles (BMW's) I have had zero luck with the repair feature after trying on 4 different batteries, but possibly they were just unrepairable? Over all I would either spend more on a Genius or less on a simple float charger.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Price

customer_reviews.title: POS. Doesn’t work. Never worked. Not sure ...
customer_reviews.text: POS. Doesn’t work. Never worked. Not sure if this is a Chinese knock off but either way don’t buy it. My neighbor bought one as well and his broke almost immediately. DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Pinckney

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY CHARGER PLUS
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my new Stanley BC25BS charger for recharging my boat trolling motor. This charger has several features that I have particularly liked. Previous chargers I have bought used the digital numbers to indicate the charging status of the battery. I prefer the older method of a pointer which indicated percentage level of charge. I also like the storage system for the clamps when I am not using the charger. I am pleased with the rapidity that this charger completes a charge on the battery.
customer_reviews.author: RGueter

customer_reviews.title: don't be lured in by the features..
customer_reviews.text: didn't last a day. had high hopes, great feature list, but in the middle of a charge it just went dead and would not come back on. looked in the manual and saw bacchus global on the back.. had same experience with a black and decker jump starter i got as a gift a while back. didn;t realize Stanley was Bacchus now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Device does not work. Customer support does not answer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device and tested it upon receiving it. After 2 months of sitting in the box (I have only used the charger 1 time), it will not power on at all. Contacting customer support seems to be fruitless as the call center does not answer and leaves me on hold for hours. Emails also go unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: David Slubowski

customer_reviews.title: Light, portable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Having used battery chargers for the past 34 years in a commercial business, this charger is really a good bargain. Using it for the time since purchased, it's really done well. Good features with easy to operate controls, large clear indicators. Only thing I have found is ( not a big issue ) the battery voltage reading when charging is a little low. Over All a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rotortop 69

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty great the first time I wanted to float charge a battery, now it refuses to float anything and just automatically goes into recondition mode. No errors nothing about this in the manual. Thought the price point would make this worth more than the lower price options but apparently nobody wants to just make a real battery charger anymore.
customer_reviews.author: David McNally

customer_reviews.title: A charger it is.  A desulfator it is not.
customer_reviews.text: Reconditioning... doesn't. I have attempted to recondition a battery that is only giving me about 340 CCA out of a rated 750 CCA. I've attempted to recondition it about 10 times/days with the same results. My understanding is that desulfating a battery takes months, yet this product claims to do it in days. Nope. Charging batteries... Yep. I charged two deep cycle batteries in series overnight. Next morning both were nicely topped off.
customer_reviews.author: ezjam

customer_reviews.title: The Warranty Company is a Joke
customer_reviews.text: My unit failed. I jump through hoops sending info and etc for Baccus Global Warranty & Distribution Center. Took them forever and a day to get them to respond. They finally responded, after about a month with some letter apologizing and etc. Never again will I buy a Stanley Product not deal with any warranty with Baccus.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 6 months past the one year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year and a half. Have tried it now on several different batteries and it will charge for a few minutes and then shut down completely. Had a one year warranty so it looks like I'll just have to throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Boojadean

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this charger
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend this charger. I got it for the safety features, but after using on multiple cars on multiple batteries, it keeps shutting itself off after charging for 3 minutes. And it does repeatedly. I originally thought it was a problem with the battery. But after time and time again it keeps doing it. I'm giving up on this thing
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: if it works, seems good
customer_reviews.text: First one showed 6 volts on a 12 volt battery...charged at like 15 volts and showed like 10 volts on battery while charging (my volt meter showed 15 volts). Had to send it back. Second one is working great. I really like the places to store the cords. Hope it last!
customer_reviews.author: onyoursix

customer_reviews.title: This item did not jump start my 3.5 month dead Battery
customer_reviews.text: My battery was dead after sitting for my 4 week vacation. So after sitting for 3.5 months I bought this Stanley charger. After several 90 second charges I could not jump start my car. So I used the battery charger mode over night and then it started that morning. So keep this point in mind when considering buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S

customer_reviews.title: Very good charger for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with this charger and especially like the restore charge feature which I used to recharge a relatively new battery that just wasn't working well. After using Restore setting it is back in charge. (Sorry, it just slipped out...) Anyway, I also like that it is built rugged and how the cables all have a way to stow away so it's nice and tidy to put away. The clamps are more sturdy than most chargers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: Worked once now all i get is Flow message, Support is non-existent been on hold for 45min before gave up and ordered a different brand , reviews on the Stanley site give this 2.1 stars which in my opinion is way high. Site say's it has 1yr limited warranty which is good if you could contact them.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Failed on 2nd time using
customer_reviews.text: I set it up to charge a dead battery, looked fine. 5 minutes later, I came back and the charger was completely dead - no screen, nothing. Sending it in for warranty, but as the turnaround is 2-3 weeks, I'll have to get another (different) one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Charger
customer_reviews.text: This charger replaced a 40 year old charger. I use it mainly for a starter battery and a deep cycle battery for my boat. I hooked it up to my brand new starter battery. I came back the next day and it was it trickle mode. Did the same for my deep cycle battery. Same results. Absolutely perfect. Simple to use, light weight, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good Setting On The Bench
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe anything works on this charger except the voltage check function. Every Time I've tried to use charger it immediately goes to float charge. It might work as a battery maintainer, I don't know as I've only tried to use it when battery has been discharged below point where vehicle will not start.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this it was 25 amps for $50. It works so good. It brought my dead lawnmower battery back to life and my Dead car battery back to life. The lawnmower battery was dead for over 3 years. I drilled holes in it to give it more air for cooling but I'm like that.
customer_reviews.author: SASQUATCH

customer_reviews.title: It worked when others couldn’t
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, my wife has a z06 corvette, because of an illness she hasn’t driven it much the last several years and the battery continually goes dead, several replacement batteries and my previous battery charger could not revive the present battery, I was going to buy another battery then I found this charger and thought why not wasn’t expensive and I would give it a try, got it in a few days, a completely dead battery, dead, within a hour and 1/2 it started and 2 hours fully charged, no problems since, this little system is amazing, simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond N Sesma

customer_reviews.title: Don't charge AGM batteries
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 30 days, on day 31, the screen goes blank. Update: Charged a AGM battery and that's when the next time I used the charger the screen was blank. Tried using it the next day and it works now. Don't charge AGM batteries, even tho it says it will.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Might just burst in to flames!
customer_reviews.text: On July 2nd 2019 I bought this charger to replace a battery charger I'd only had a couple of years that had quit working. Today I actually needed to use it. I had a dead battery in my 1985 Ford Econoline, I connected the positive lead to the positive terminal on the battery, the ground lead to ground and then plugged in the AC cable. When I hit the Charge button the battery charger arced, sparked, buzzed, then burst in to flames! Why oh why does everything these days need to be made from HCP (Highly Compressed Poo). I can't recommend this charger. Be afraid, be very afraid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Charger, fast and slow * WILL NOT WORK WITH MOTORCYCLES* as-is  \(*0*)/
customer_reviews.text: This is a great charger, after years of cheapos that stop working after one winter, its nice to finally get a 'real' one, but: If you are a motorcycle person, the clamps on this are too blunt to work on a motorcycle. You will need to fab some tabs or HD wire leads to give something for the clamps to grab on to.
customer_reviews.author: Glitterkat59 - Frustrated Artist

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: After almost one year the cooling fan stopped working. I called them and they sent me a replacement unit brand new. But, the new unit would not power up. I have been trying a week to contact them yet no answer!!! I went from a working unit to a non-working one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: So the product us easy to use and has a great price BUT I got a lemon. I got it replaced and then the second one didn’t only not work but the whole front plate was upside down as id someone had put it on backwards in production or refurbishing. It was a very big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond

customer_reviews.title: Love the screen, shows voltage
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems high, what you expect from a name brand like Stanley. Love having the screen. So far its charged a dead battery overnight and automatically switched to float charging for a week now. Looking forward to having this 15 amp model for years.
customer_reviews.author: David Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Really like this charger
customer_reviews.text: Here is what I really like about this charger. First one I ever owned that displayed the charging amps going into the battery in digital display. The state of charge guage is like a car fuel guage. I would prefer a real digital readout in numbers but I can live with it. I feel for the money its a good charger. In a couple of months I'm going to buy another one for my Florida home.
customer_reviews.author: Art B

customer_reviews.title: A little touchy but works
customer_reviews.text: This charger is fully automatic and charges well. I have several 12V ride on toys that I have to charge regularly. The unit is really touchy about the contact to the batteries and many times I have to fidget with the clamps before it will accept the connection.
customer_reviews.author: Cavin Greer

customer_reviews.title: Charges when you have given up prior to this tool
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, we had accidentally left a tailgate on out Hyundai barely open for one month while on vacation (it was in the garage) and after hooking this up we had the car going in only 4 hours. My stepson's car was not holding a charge - we reconditioned his battery and used the alt. check to find he had a bad alternator. Instructions are simple
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable: failed outside of one year warrenty and no way to fix it
customer_reviews.text: I've hardly used this charger. The few times I did, it worked as advertised. I didn't abuse or drop it. It was always inside my barn. I have seven vehicles and used various chargers for all of them while on an extended vacation. Came home and all chargers had worked well except this Stanley BC15BS. I checked the owners manual, and it said nothing about problems with the unit. I called customer support and the rep said there was nothing to do except send it to a service center. Too bad this unit was completely unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: david j dumontier

customer_reviews.title: I bought the second one for my Dad
customer_reviews.text: I gave this one to my Dad for Christmas. Unfortunately it stopped working in March. 4 Months was not quite the life span I expected. I sent an email to the company I purchased it from, they are replacing it. Great customer service. Can't ask for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: A charger not to buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks so bad it's hard to write a review. Has not charged any battery I have used it on. My only regret is that I didn't return it within the window so now I'm stuck with a charger that can't charge a car battery at all in over 3 days. Thanks Stanley! This thing Sucks!
customer_reviews.author: halvorg

customer_reviews.title: Keeps saying theres the battery is disconnected.
customer_reviews.text: Intermittently/often stops and says the battery is disconnected (shows flashing cables). Has a very good connection to clean terminals on a nearly new Braille battery. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S.

customer_reviews.title: Charger reads that the battery is fully charged when actual ...
customer_reviews.text: Charger reads that the battery is fully charged when actual voltage is half of what it should be - And that was after the second time I used it!
customer_reviews.author: Suspect #4

customer_reviews.title: Expensive wheel chuck.
customer_reviews.text: Worthless junk. Died after one use. Now it just sits there with the leads on the battery and says "float" and won't charge or trickle charge but let's the battery die. I now have a nice looking wheel chuck. I hooked up my old battery charger from the seventies and right away started charging at 6 amps DC.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Will indicate a Battery is "Charged" and it will not be at a full state.
customer_reviews.text: Charger indicated my battery was 12.6 V. Would not crank my Riding Mower. Tried the "Jump" with charger, It did not work ether. Bought a New Battery and It started my mower right away. Also tried to revive a Deep Cycle Battery. Would not even give me an indication of the condition of this unit. This is "JUNK" Buy something else !!
customer_reviews.author: Ray E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, would recommend to all
customer_reviews.text: Im currently happy with this charger...So far I have charged two batteries.. One in my Jeep and the other in a Honda.. This charger did it's job well, it also accurately tested the voltage on both batteries before and after charging. I would recommend this product to anyone and would buy again. update: 08/24/2018 still working like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: WatersMK

customer_reviews.title: Only good for batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Not as effective in coaxing a confession as one would expect... but it will charge a car battery. So that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: DOMi

customer_reviews.title: This has brought 3 old dead batteries back to life
customer_reviews.text: If you broke this thing your just abusive. This has brought 3 old dead batteries back to life. If this will not charge your batteries you will need to use the repair setting because it will not recognize super low voltages. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Way Too Critical

customer_reviews.title: Delivered non- functional
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as used like new. Did not work out of the box. Shouldn't have been surprised as there were 3shipping labels visible on the box. Believe supplier may have just resent a returned item with no repair. Returned no hassle,just wasted time.
customer_reviews.author: words have meaning

customer_reviews.title: Battery charger stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It worked good for a while but it stopped working. Is there a warranty on this battery charge.
customer_reviews.author: Terru James

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay for a few months, then it would charge since batteries, but not others. Now it won't charge anything. It just says FLO. My old school battery charger will charge any battery. This "smart" charger is a waste of space.
customer_reviews.author: RGnad

customer_reviews.title: charges fast
customer_reviews.text: I have used it twice, it seems to charge faster than I expected. I had left the lights on in my old truck that does not warn you they were left on. Jumped it with my jumper battery and made a delivery. Hooked up the charger when I got home, it indicated 25% charged. Came back 2 hours to check on it and it was fully charged. It may have took only one hour. I'll have to check sooner next time.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL A MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Worked once, then never again.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time I tried to use it, it wouldn't work, kept saying it was already charged. Battery was completely dead. So I hooked it up to a conventional charger and got it up to 11v. Same thing when I hook up this charger. Wont charge, wont jump. Unit is completely useless. I would recommend to stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk. We used it once when ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. We used it once when we purchased it and a few months later (3 months) when we needed it again the charger was no longer working and the option to return has expired.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R

customer_reviews.title: replacement working!
customer_reviews.text: this was a replacement from previous. previous model was rattling when fan was running, must had a screw lose or something. this unit it working correctly and charging battery. overall functions well.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Good charger for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged build with larger better terminal clips than on many chargers. Good screen graphics and selector buttons. I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C.

customer_reviews.title: Read ALL the instructions before getting confused!
customer_reviews.text: ON A COMPLETELY DEAD BATTERY, this charger WILL charge at 15 amps and drops down as the battery reaches different charge levels. NOT CONTINOUS 15 AMP CHARGE! SO IT TAKES LONGER FOR THE BATTERY TO REACH FULL CHARGE! ENGINE START WILL NOT PRODUCE 40 AMPS UNLESS THE BATTERY IS COMPLETELY DEAD AND YOU HAVE TO WAIT SEVERAL MINUTES (DEPENDING ON BATTERY CHARGE LEVEL), BEFORE THE CHARGER WILL ACTIVATE THE ENGINE START FUNCTION! NO INSTANT ENGINE START! DON'T KNOW WHY THEY CALL IT "ENGINE START" IF YOU HAVE TO WAIT FOR THE BATTERY TO CHARGE.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar W.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why there's a "battery life" category, because this is a battery charger, not a device that uses batteries, but I don't know how to get rid of that category, so I gave it a 5 anyway. I like the read-out for percentage of charge, voltage and so forth. The same product seems to be sold under other brand names at higher prices. I like that it gradually tapers the charge down to constant battery maintenance mode, and switches off the cooling fan automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Morris G. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Our van was really, really dead. Left jumper cables on it with another vehicle running for 20 minutes with no luck. This had it running in about 2 minutes. Same result for a friends vehicle and they suggested I start selling these things as they bought their own afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Walker

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Used the charger 3-4 times and now, when I connect it to a dead battery, it switches to float after a few seconds, claiming the battery is fully charged. Had the same results on two different dead batteries. Don't waste your money. I'm well past the warranty date but we'll see what the manufacturer says.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kriebel

customer_reviews.title: Best battery charger ever
customer_reviews.text: Best battery charger ever got this battery charger for my son birthday he had a battery that had been sitting Dead for four months he needed a battery for his trolling motor he charge the battery for two days with this battery charger and now it will start a car and has been sitting for a week and still shows 13 V
customer_reviews.author: james may

product_meta.title: STANLEY BC15BS Fully Automatic 15 Amp 12V Bench Battery Charger/Maintainer with 40A Engine Start, Alternator Check, Cable Clamps
feature_bullets: 15 amp bench battery charger maintains and charges any AGM, GEL, or WET automotive or marine 12V battery
Fully automatic high frequency charging delivers 3 stage charging, automatically switching from fast charge, to top-off, to trickle charge
Battery reconditioning feature helps extend battery life; 40 amp engine start helps start your vehicle in about 90 seconds
Equipped with reverse polarity protection; LCD screen displays charging status and battery status with easy to understand icons
Features a patented alternator check which indicates if the alternator is maintaining battery level; ETL Certified for performance and safety
Automatically compensates for lower voltage caused by extension cords
categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
